Yoruba: Ẹ káàárọ̀ dọ́kítà, ara mi ò yá.
Nupe: Kube lazhin dokita, nakan ji mi yan.
English: Good morning doctor, I am not feeling well.

Yoruba: Pẹ̀lẹ́. Wá jókòó síbí.
Nupe: Oku. Fedun shi a bo.
English: Sorry. Please sit here.

Yoruba: Báwo ló ṣe ń ṣe ọ́ gan-an ní pàtó?
Nupe: Ki yi ena e ji we 'tso gangan yi na o?
English: What exactly is wrong with you?

Yoruba: Orí ń fọ́ mi, ara mi ń gbóná, mi ò lágbára, mi ò sì tún lè jẹun.
Nupe: Eti e san mi, nakan min e wona, mi e wo to 'ebo, eginci ma ye gi a.
English: I have a headache, I feel hot, I am weak, and I can't eat.

Yoruba: Látí ìgbà wo ló ti ń ṣe ọ́ báyìí?
Nupe: Tun dagan foci n ya o?
English: How long have you been feeling this way?

Yoruba: Láti ọ̀sán àná nígbàtí mo ti ọjà dé.
Nupe: Tun dagan tuwo ro na mi zhin dzuko na.
English: Since yesterday afternoon when I returned from the market.

Yoruba: Ǹjẹ́ ẹ̀fọ́rí àti ara gbígbóná nìkan ló ń ṣe ọ́?
Nupe: Etisan be nakan nawo gbugi ga o ko?
English: Is it just the headache and fever that you have?

Yoruba: Rárá dọ́kítà. Ó dàbí i pé mo fẹ́ bì, ọ̀nạ̀-ọ̀fun sì tún ń dùn mí.
Nupe: Haha dokita. Egban e gun mi, to bere ma'e tan mi.
English: No doctor. I also feel like vomiting, and my throat hurts.

Yoruba: Pẹ̀lẹ́. La ẹnu rẹ, jẹ́ kí n yẹ̀ ọ́ wò.
Nupe: Oku. Pe emi we, lugwa mi n cin un le.
English: Sorry. Open your mouth, let me check.

Yoruba: Ó dàbí pé o fẹ́ ní Ibà díẹ̀, ṣùgbọ́n a ó ṣe àyẹ̀wò ẹ̀jẹ̀ kí a tó lè mọ̀ ní pàtó.
Nupe: Mi e cin un le gan iba e jin wo yo, ama yi a jin tsuwandan bedzo.
English: It seems you have a bit of malaria, but we will run a blood test to confirm.

Yoruba: Jẹ́ kí n wo bí ara rẹ ṣe gbóná sí.
Nupe: Lugwa min cin nakan nawo wo le de.
English: Let me check how high your temperature is.

Yoruba: Ǹjẹ́ o ti lo òògùn kankan?
Nupe: Wo ma lo cigbe ndoro a ni?
English: Have you taken any medication?

Yoruba: Bẹ́ẹ̀ni dókítà, mo lo òògùn ẹ̀fọ́rí àti ara ríro.
Nupe: Eba dokita. Mi lo cigbe yan nakan tan.
English: Yes doctor, I took some headache and body ache medicine.

Yoruba: Ta ló sọ fún ọ wí pé kó o lò ó?
Nupe: Zhi gangan wo 'lo won?
English: Who told you to take it?

Yoruba: Kò s’ẹ́nì kankan, mo kàn lò ó fúnra mi náà ni.
Nupe: Zan doro gan, mi tso loyan mi o.
English: No one, I just took it on my own.

Yoruba: Kílódé tó o fi lò ó?
Nupe: Ki la wo ci lo won o?
English: Why did you take it?

Yoruba: Torípé orí ń fọ́ mi.
Nupe: Ebo etisan o.
English: Because I had a headache.

Yoruba: Má ṣe yọ araà rẹ lẹ́nu
Nupe: Ka jin damuwa ma.
English: Don't worry yourself

Yoruba: Ṣó o fẹ́ kí ara rẹ tètè yá?
Nupe: We e wa lafiya be egwa tso e ya rayi we ko?
English: Do you want to get well quickly?

Yoruba: Ẹ káàárọ̀ dọ́kítà
Nupe: Kube lazhin dokita.
English: Good morning doctor

Yoruba: Ojú ẹ funfun, ohùn rẹ sì yàtọ̀ sí ti tẹ́lẹ̀
Nupe: Eye wo n na a shi zhiko degi, bere we ma a peri.
English: Your eyes are pale, and your voice is different from before.

Yoruba: Bẹ́ẹ̀ni dókítà, ara mi ń gbóná, ọ̀nạ̀-ọ̀fun sì ń dùn mí
Nupe: Acin ga o dokita. Nakan mi e wona, to bere ma e tan mi.
English: Yes doctor, I feel hot, and my throat hurts.

Yoruba: Ẹ̀ẹ̀mẹta lójúmọ́ lo ma lò ó lẹ́yìn tí o bá jẹun tán.
Nupe: Zuguta foni wa 'lo won, wo ga eginci gi dzo na.
English: You should take it three times a day after meals.

Yoruba: Àárọ̀, ọ̀sán, alẹ́ lo máa lò ó lẹ́yìn tí o bá jẹun tán.
Nupe: Wo ga lo lazhin, wa ke u ye lo igidi to yeshi, wo ga eginci gi zho na.
English: Morning, afternoon, and night you will take it after meals.

Yoruba: Àwọn nọ́ọ̀sì yóó ṣàlàyé bí o ó ṣe lò ó.
Nupe: Noosi zhi a jin bayani ki an do na wo a lulo na ya we.
English: The nurses will explain how you will take it.

Yoruba: Abẹ́rẹ́ mẹ́ta lo máa gbà.
Nupe: Ekin guta wa' go o.
English: You will take three injections.

Yoruba: Àwọn nọ́ọ̀sì yóò ṣàlàyé fún ọ
Nupe: Noosi zhi a jin bayani ya we.
English: The nurses will explain to you.

Yoruba: Abẹ́rẹ́ mélòó lo ti gbà?
Nupe: Ekin gu kin wo go a ni o?
English: How many injections have you taken?

Yoruba: Ǹjẹ́ ó ń dí ọ lọ́wọ́ láti lè sùn?
Nupe: Ngan we'e kan wo ele n le a ko?
English: Is it preventing you from sleeping?

Yoruba: Abẹ́rẹ́ mélòó ni wọ́n ti fún ọ?
Nupe: Ekin gun kin a la ya wo ya ni?
English: How many injections have they given you?

Yoruba: Ǹjẹ́ o ní àìsàn abẹ́lẹ̀ kankan?
Nupe: Batan kici zhi dan be wo yin le o?
English: Do you have any internal illness?

Yoruba: Ǹjẹ́ ẹ ní àìsàn kankan tó gbajúmọ̀ nínú ẹbí yín?
Nupe: Batan kici zhi fi ezan yan zami ezhi bo ?
English: Do you have any hereditary illness in your family?

Yoruba: Ǹjẹ́ o ní àìsàn ẹ̀jẹ̀ ríru?
Nupe: Wo de ejiagun?
English: Do you have anemia?

Yoruba: Ǹjẹ́ o ní àìsàn ikọ́-ásímà
Nupe: Wo de batan yan esun kanta?
English: Do you have asthma?

Yoruba: Ǹjẹ́ o ní àìsàn ìtọ-ṣúgà?
Nupe: Wo de batan yan sanmana (suga)?
English: Do you have diabetes?

Yoruba: Jọ̀ọ́ dùbúlẹ̀ sórí tábìlì yìí
Nupe: Le ci ta eti a bo.
English: Please lie down on this table

Yoruba: Mí sínú
Nupe: Sun sun ya kin fi nibo.
English: Breathe in

Yoruba: Mí síta
Nupe: Sun sun tin ya.
English: Breathe out

Yoruba: Sé èémí rẹ fún iṣẹ́jú-àáyá mẹ́wàá
Nupe: Kan esun wo ta ya 'yebagi guwo.
English: Hold your breath for ten seconds

Yoruba: Ǹjẹ́ o ti sun ilé-ìwòsàn rí fún ìtọ́jú àìsàn kan tàbí òmíràn?
Nupe: A kan wo ta asibiti o le ani?
English: Have you been hospitalized for any illness before?

Yoruba: Ǹjẹ́ wọn ti ṣiṣẹ́ abẹ fún ọ rí?
Nupe: A lo etun ya wo le ani?
English: Have you had any surgery before?

Yoruba: Ààmì àìsàn onígbáméjì nìyí
Nupe: Alama yan batan yan foro be manzuwa e yi na o.
English: These are symptoms of diabetes

Yoruba: Rí i dájú pé ò ń mu omi lóòrè-kóòrè
Nupe: Ce fin nuwon ka n doro.
English: Make sure you drink water regularly

Yoruba: Máa se oúnjẹ rẹ dáadáa kí o sì máa jẹ èsò púpọ̀
Nupe: Ce la eginci we jin ge wagin, o mo o ce gin eginci sunsunci dokun
English: Prepare your food well and eat lots of fruits

Yoruba: Ǹjẹ́ ọmọ náà ti gba àjẹsára?
Nupe: Egi na a ekin yan gigbere kagun go a ni?
English: Has the child been vaccinated?

Yoruba: Ọjọ́ wo ni yóò gba àjẹsára mìíràn?
Nupe: Foci a gan e ke ye be go ekin yan gigbere kagun o?
English: When will he get another vaccination?

Yoruba: Ọmọ oṣù mélòó ni?
Nupe: Egi twsa gukin un yi o?
English: How many months old is the child?

Yoruba: Ọmọ ọdún mélòó ni?
Nupe: Egi 'ya gunkin un yi o?
English: How old is the child?

Yoruba: Ó ṣe pàtàkì fún ìlera ọmọdé
Nupe: Wun ge ya lafiya yan egi wawagi zhi.
English: It is important for the health of the child

Yoruba: Ó ṣe pàtàkì fún ìlera ara wa
Nupe: Wun ge ya lafiya yan nakan pache yi.
English: It is important for our health

Yoruba: Ó tó ìgbà wo tí o ti ń wúkọ́?
Nupe: Tun dagan foci epa na ya o?
English: How long have you had a cough?

Yoruba: Ǹjẹ́ ò ń tu kẹ̀lẹ̀bẹ̀ jáde?
Nupe: Wo ga kpakpa wen e de ecin ko?
English: Are you coughing up mucus?

Yoruba: Kí ni àwọ̀ kẹ̀lẹ̀bẹ̀ tí ẹ̀ ń tu?
Nupe: Ki yi nuwon ya mincini wo yo?
English: What color is the mucus you are coughing up?

Yoruba: Ṣé ara rẹ ń gbọ́ná?
Nupe: Nakan wo e wo na?
English: Does your body feel hot?

Yoruba: Ǹjẹ́ òtútù ń mú ẹ?
Nupe: Wo e wo efe?
English: Do you feel cold?

Yoruba: Ǹjẹ́ o máa ń làágùn kíkan-kíkan lálẹ́?
Nupe: Wo e cinu dan eshi o sarayin?
English: Do you sweat at night?

Yoruba: Ǹjẹ́ ọ̀ ń lè jẹun?
Nupe: Eginci e ye gi ya we?
English: Can you eat?

Yoruba: Ǹjẹ́ ó ní nǹkankan tí ó máa ń mú ìnira bá ọ bí o bá jẹ ẹ́ tàbí ṣe é?
Nupe: Wo de balegi ndoro?
English: Is there anything that troubles you when you eat or drink?

Yoruba: Ǹjẹ́ o ní àìsàn ọgbẹ́-inú?
Nupe: Wo de egbo wunci osa?
English: Do you have constipation?

Yoruba: Ààrun òhún máa ń ràn
Nupe: Batan na kuka za wo.
English: This disease can be contagious

Yoruba: Ààrun náà ń ràn kíákíá
Nupe: Cigun na e la ma nakan kezhe be gwa'tso e.
English: This disease spreads quickly

Yoruba: Ààrun àbínibí ni ààrun náà
Nupe: Batan nna e ma za ma biu yin.
English: This disease can be hereditary

Yoruba: Ó ṣe è ṣe kí ó jẹ́ àìsàn ìdílé ni àìsàn ọ̀hún
Nupe: Un jin wo gan batan na dan ezan e bo dan
English: It can be a familial disease

Yoruba: Ó máa ń ran ara wa lọ́wọ́ láti gbógun ti àjàkálẹ̀ àrùn
Nupe: We kan gwa cigun nakan o.
English: It helps our body to fight off epidemics

Yoruba: Àpọ̀jù ṣúgà ń ṣàkóbá fún ìlera wa
Nupe: Eyan mana ge ya nakan pace yi un ga ganagan na.
English: Too much sugar is harmful to our health

Yoruba: Ọtí àmuju lè ṣàkóbá fún ara wa
Nupe: Ege e la waala be ya lafiya yan nakan pace za'ngi.
English: Alcohol consumption can harm our body

Yoruba: Ẹ jẹ́ kí a mutí mọ níwọ̀n
Nupe: Elugwa yi pe ya be eyan fin.
English: Let us drink moderately

Yoruba: Sìgá mímu léwu fun ara wa
Nupe: Ciga gee ya lafiya yi a.
English: Smoking is harmful to our body

Yoruba: A ò tí ì mọ ohun tó fà á
Nupe: Yi la pe ena gu beyin naa.
English: We don't know the cause yet

Yoruba: A ò tí ì lè sọ pé àìsàn kan ni ní pàtó àyàfì tí a bá ti ṣe àwọn àyẹ̀wò kan
Nupe: Yi la gan wo gan eyan kazan e ji wo ya, seyi a ga tsuwon zhi jin bedzo.
English: We cannot say that it is a particular illness unless we have done some tests.

Yoruba: Ó yẹ kí ẹ rí i rà ní ilé-ìtòògùn wa
Nupe: Wa de u shi kata bana e kun cigbe na.
English: You should buy it at our pharmacy.

Yoruba: Ẹ jọ̀ọ́ ẹ níláti yẹra fún lílo òògùn tí dókítà ò kọ fún-un yín
Nupe: Fa, gan be cigbe lilo e ka a kuka ya we asibiti bo o ana.
English: Please avoid using medication not prescribed to you by a doctor.

Yoruba: O kì í ṣe dọ́kítá
Nupe: Wo jin dokita a.
English: You are not a doctor.

Yoruba: Ẹ̀yin kọ́ ní dókítà
Nupe: Un jin wo yi dokita a.
English: You are not doctors.

Yoruba: Ẹ jọ̀ó ẹ pe dókítà wá
Nupe: Fa, yi dokita be yin.
English: Please call a doctor.

Yoruba: Mi ò rí oorun sùn
Nupe: Mi de ele le a.
English: I did not sleep well.

Yoruba: A máa a fun ọ ní òògun oorun lò
Nupe: Aa la cigbe ele ya we.
English: We will give you sleeping medication.

Yoruba: Ìsinmi tó tó nìkan ni o nílò
Nupe: Efa gbubi ga nakan we e wa o.
English: You only need sufficient rest.

Yoruba: Rí i dájú pé ò ń lo ìgò-ojú rẹ bí o bá fẹ́ lo fóònù rẹ
Nupe: Ce la bayele wo pe eye wo ga yi seeti gwa na.
English: Make sure you use your glasses if you want to use your phone.

Yoruba: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn ènìyàn tó ní ààrùn onígbáméjì ni kìí ní àpẹrẹ tàbí àmì àìsàn yìí rara,
Nupe: Kama kama za na zhi de batan yan foro be manzuwa na e de alama u ndoro a.
English: Many people with diabetes do not show any signs or symptoms at all.

Yoruba: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn ènìyàn tó ní ààrùn onígbáméjì lè má ní àpẹrẹ tàbí àmì àìsàn yìí
Nupe: Kama kama yan zana zhi de batan yan foro be manzuwa na, un jin wo a ga de alama ndoro ma.
English: Many people with diabetes may not show any signs or symptoms.

Yoruba: Awọn mìíran, lè nira gidigidi, ó sì lè la ikú lọ.
Nupe: Sashi zi e dee daman, un ma wu za wo.
English: For others, it can be very severe and could lead to death.

Yoruba: Inú-ríru àti èébì
Nupe: Manzuwa be tuntun i.
English: Stomach pain and vomiting.

Yoruba: Igbẹ́ gbuuru àti òòyì kíkọ́
Nupe: Foro be eyi i.
English: Diarrhea and frequent urination.

Yoruba: Ìríra, àìlókun-inú, tàbí oorun àsùnjù
Nupe: Eban ze, nakan gban be, ele ko yigbe ta ka ndoro e.
English: Nausea, loss of appetite, or insomnia.

Yoruba: Lára àwọn àmì ààrùn onígbáméjì tí a sábà má ń rí nìwọ̀nyí
Nupe: Alama yan batan yan foro be manzuwa zhi yi;
English: These are some of the common symptoms of diabetes.

Yoruba: Kí ọkàn àti ẹ̀jẹ̀ ènìyàn máa ṣe ségesège
Nupe: Sugan gbin be ekpa pa na a gan cin zhin na e.
English: That the person's heart and blood should function properly.

Yoruba: Ènìyàn lè ní ààrùn onígbáméjì bí wọ́n bá jẹ oúnjẹ tàbí mu omi tí o bá ti farakó
Nupe: Eza e ku batan yan foro be manzuwa e dagan eginci ko nuwan na ga ka shikan na.
English: A person may have diabetes if they eat food or drink water that is contaminated.

Yoruba: Farakó ìgbẹ́ ẹni tí ó ti ní ààrùn náà
Nupe: Na ga ka shepata yan zana de batan yan foro be manzuwa na.
English: Contaminated stool of someone who already has the illness.

Yoruba: A níláti se omi tàbí fi apàlàmọ́ sínú omi ti a fẹ́ mu tàbí fi se oúnjẹ
Nupe: Ce la nuwon finfinci ko na e la ji eginci na du tana wangin bedzo.
English: We need to boil water or add chlorine to water we want to drink or use for cooking.

Yoruba: Fọ ọwọ́ rẹ lóòrèkóòrè pẹ̀lú ọṣẹ àti omi tó mọ́
Nupe: Ce la egwa we na ya wangin be eko to nuwan naga tinye na e.
English: Wash your hands regularly with soap and clean water.

Yoruba: Ìtọ̀ ṣúgà
Nupe: Batan ya sanman ko suga.
English: Urinating frequently.

Yoruba: Ẹ̀fọ́rí
Nupe: Eti san.
English: Headache.

Yoruba: Ibà
Nupe: Iba.
English: Fever.

Yoruba: Ibà pọ́njú-pọ́ntọ̀
Nupe: Batan yan eye duru.
English: High fever.

Yoruba: Ibà jẹ̀fun-jẹ̀dọ̀
Nupe: Batan yan edugi.
English: Yellow fever.

Yoruba: Ẹ̀yìn ríro
Nupe: Ikan tan.
English: Body aches.

Yoruba: Àtọ̀sí
Nupe: Twashi.
English: Weakness.

Yoruba: Aromọléegun
Nupe: Wukansanagi.
English: Malaria.

Yoruba: Ikọ́ ife
Nupe: Ekpayiringi.
English: Whooping cough.

Yoruba: Bèlúbèlú
Nupe: Belu -belu.
English: Jaundice.

Yoruba: Ọgbẹ́-inú
Nupe: Egbo ko osa yan gbako
English: Stomach ulcers.

Yoruba: Ẹ̀jẹ̀ ríru
Nupe: Ejiagun.
English: Blood clot.

Yoruba: Òtútù àyà
Nupe: Batan yan eye fuka.
English: Chest cold.

Yoruba: Àjàkàlẹ̀ ààrùn
Nupe: Cigun na lagba mi na.
English: Epidemic.

Yoruba: Agbẹ̀bí
Nupe: Noosi na zhi e maa gi na.
English: Midwife.

Yoruba: Dọ́kítà ojú
Nupe: Dokita yan eye.
English: Eye doctor (Optometrist).

Yoruba: Dọ́kítà àwọn ọmọdé
Nupe: Dokita yan egi wawagi zhi.
English: Pediatrician.

Yoruba: Àjẹsára
Nupe: Gigbere kagun.
English: Immunization.

Yoruba: Dọ́kítà oníṣẹ́-abẹ
Nupe: Dokita yan etun 'bi.
English: Surgeon.

Yoruba: Ìwòsàn
Nupe: Egunsa.
English: Treatment.

Yoruba: Ìwé òògùn
Nupe: Takada yan cigbe.
English: Prescription.

Yoruba: Àtúnṣe
Nupe: Cigbe.
English: Adjustment.

Yoruba: Òògun apakòkòrò-ara
Nupe: Cigbe na e wu gbere na.
English: Immunosuppressant.

Yoruba: Abẹ́rẹ́
Nupe: Ekin
English: Injection.

Yoruba: Òògun oní-hóóró
Nupe: Cigbe sunsun.
English: Antibiotic.

Yoruba: Òògun olómi
Nupe: Cigbe yan nuwon.
English: Liquid medicine.

Yoruba: Òògun amúniyàgbẹ́
Nupe: Cigbe na e la 'za tsabi na.
English: Painkiller.

Yoruba: Ẹ kạ́àárọ̀. Kí ni mo lè ṣe fún-un yín?
Nupe: Kube lazhin. Ki we e wa o?
English: Good morning. How can I help you?

Yoruba: Ẹ kạ́àárọ̀. Kí ni mo lè ṣe fún-un yín lénìí?
Nupe: Kube lazhin. Ki mi jin ya we wo ina o?
English: Good morning. How can I help you today?

Yoruba: Ẹ kạ́àárọ̀. Ìrànlọ́wọ́ wo ni mo lè ṣe fún-un yín?
Nupe: Kube lazhin. Ki mi jin ya we wo?
English: Good morning. What assistance can I provide you?

Yoruba: Ara mi ò yá lẹ́nu ọjọ́ mẹ́ta yìí, ara gbígbóná àti ara ríro. Ẹ̀rù ń bà mí pé ó le jẹ́ Ibà.
Nupe: Toshi, nakan ji mi yan a, nakan nawo be nakan tan e. Mi e cin le gan mi a de iba.
English: I haven't felt well in the last three days, my body is hot and aching. I am afraid it might be fever.

Yoruba: Ara mi ò yá lẹ́nu ọjọ́ mẹ́ta yìí, ara mi ń gbóná ara sì ń ro mi. Ẹ̀rù ń bà mí pé ó le jẹ́ Ibà.
Nupe: Toshi, nakan ji mi yan a, nakan mi e wona, nakan ma e tan mi. Mi e cin le gan mi a de iba.
English: I haven't felt well in the last three days, my body is hot and aching. I am afraid it might be fever.

Yoruba: Kò burú. Ǹjẹ́ nǹkan mìíràn wà?
Nupe: To. Be ki be o?
English: No problem. Is there anything else?

Yoruba: Béẹ̀ni, orí ń fọ́ mi, èébì díẹ̀ náà sì ń gbé mi.
Nupe: E, mi e wo etisan be manzuwa e.
English: Yes, I have a headache and a bit of nausea.

Yoruba: Rárá. Kò sí nǹkan mìíràn.
Nupe: Haha. Ndoro ke be a.
English: No, nothing else.

Yoruba: Kò burú. A máa bẹ̀rẹ̀ pẹ̀lú àwọn àyẹ̀wò kan láti mọ ohun tó jẹ́ ní pàtó.
Nupe: Damuwa dan bo a. Tsuwanadan yi a jin bedzo yi ci pe ena ga e jin wo na o.
English: No problem. We will start with some tests to determine the exact cause.

Yoruba: A máa bẹ̀rẹ̀ pẹ̀lú àwọn àyẹ̀wò kan láti mọ ohun tó jẹ́.
Nupe: Tsuwan sashi zhi yi, yi a kayin jin o, yi de ba u pe ena jin na o.
English: We will start with some tests to find out what it is.

Yoruba: A máa bẹ̀rẹ̀ pẹ̀lú àwọn àyẹ̀wò kan láti fìdí ohun tó jẹ́ múlẹ̀.
Nupe: Tsuwan sashi zhi yi a kain jin o, yi de ba u pe ena un yi na o.
English: We will start with some tests to confirm what it is.

Yoruba: A máa bẹ̀rẹ̀ pẹ̀lú àwọn àyẹ̀wò kan láti mọ ohun tó jẹ́ ní pàtó. Ṣùgbọ́n ṣé orí ń fọ́ ọ yín tàbí èébì ń gbé yín?
Nupe: Tsuwandan yi a jin bedzo yi ci pe o. Ama n gan wo e wo etisan be manzuwa a?
English: We will start with some tests to determine the exact cause. But do you have a headache or feel nauseous?

Yoruba: Ǹjẹ́ orí ń fọ́ ọ yín tàbí èébì ń gbé yín?
Nupe: We wo manzuwa be etisan a ko?
English: Do you have a headache or feel nauseous?

Yoruba: Béẹ̀ni, mo ni ẹ̀fọ́rí, èébì díẹ̀ náà sì ń gbé mi.
Nupe: E, mi e wo etisan be manzuwa e.
English: Yes, I have a headache and a bit of nausea.

Yoruba: Béẹ̀ni, orí ń fọ́ mi, ṣùgbọ́n èébì ò gbé mi.
Nupe: E, mi e wo etisan ama mi wo manzuwa a.
English: Yes, I have a headache, but no nausea.

Yoruba: Rárá, orí ò fọ́ mi, èébì ò sì gbé mi.
Nupe: Haha, mi wo etisan a, mi ma wo manzuwa a .
English: No, I don't have a headache or nausea.

Yoruba: Àwọn nǹkan wọ̀nyí fara jọ Ibà. A máa ṣe àyẹ̀wò ẹ̀jẹ̀ láti rí àrídájú.
Nupe: Alama na zhi o ke tun ye dana be yan iba. Tsuwandan yan ejia yi a jin yi ci pe ko un ga o.
English: These symptoms resemble malaria. We will do a blood test to confirm.

Yoruba: A máa níláti ṣe àyẹ̀wò ẹ̀jẹ̀.
Nupe: Tsuwandan yan ejia yi a jin o.
English: We will need to do a blood test.

Yoruba: A máa ṣe àyẹ̀wò ẹ̀jẹ̀.
Nupe: Yi a jin tsuwandan yan ejia.
English: We will do a blood test.

Yoruba: Bákan náà, ó ṣe pàtàkì púpọ̀ kí ara má gbẹ. Báwo ni ẹ ṣe ń mu omi tó?
Nupe: Bebe ma, nuwon fin kamin ndoro ge sarayin. Ke we e fin nuwon fin na o?
English: Also, it's very important not to get dehydrated. How are you staying hydrated?

Yoruba: Ǹjẹ́ ẹ má n mu omi dáadáa?
Nupe: We fin nuwon dokun ko?
English: Are you drinking enough water?

Yoruba: Bẹ́ẹ̀ni mo máa n mu omi gan-an.
Nupe: E,mi e fin nuwon dokun ka ndoro.
English: Yes, I drink a lot of water.

Yoruba: Mò ń gbìyànjú láti mu omi, ṣùgbọ́n ó ṣòro pẹ̀lú èébì tó ń gbé mi.
Nupe: Mi e wa gan mi n ce fin nuwon kan doro, ama manzuwa yi a.
English: I try to drink water, but it's difficult because of the nausea.

Yoruba: Mò ń gbìyànjú láti mu omi, ṣùgbọ́n èébì yẹn ń jẹ́ kí ó ṣòro fún mi.
Nupe: Mi e jin kokari gan mi n ce fin nuwon kan doro, ama manzuwa yi a.
English: I try to drink water, but the nausea makes it hard.

Yoruba: Ó dáa. Tí a bá ti gba èsì àyẹ̀wò ọ̀hún, a máa sọ̀rọ̀ nípa ìtọ́jú tó yẹ.
Nupe: To, wan ge. Ezhe yan tsuwandan na zhi yi jin na ga tinya, yin a be ganagan yan cigbe na zhi o ga lo na.
English: Alright. Once we get the test results, we will discuss the appropriate treatment.

Yoruba: Kò burú. Bí a bá ti rí èsì àyẹ̀wò ọ̀hún, a máa mọ ìtọ́jú tó yẹ.
Nupe: Damuwa danbo a. Yi ga ezhe yan tsuwandan leye, yi a pe cigbe u ye.
English: No problem. When we get the test results, we will know the proper treatment.
